bioghist.p: Katrina Thomas, Bryn Mawr College class of 1949, worked as an editor and free-lance photographer in New York City from the 1950s to the 2000s. In the late 1960s she began a project to photograph weddings of ethnic groups in America. In 1987, her photographs were featured in a travelling exhibition, Something Old, Something New; Ethnic Weddings in America, sponsored by the Balch Institute for Ethnic Studies and Modern Brides magazine.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, background research papers, and photographic prints, negatives, and contact sheets relating to Thomas's ethnic weddings project.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
